numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph compares the likelihood of acceptance to an elitist college.
2. The graph compares students who have the same test scores.
3. The graph compares students by wealth.
4. The graph compares students by legacy status.
5. A legacy student has an advantage in acceptance.
6. A legacy student has an advantage regardless of social status.
7. If a student becomes wealthier then the likelihood of acceptance increases.
8. A student in the top 0.1% is 7 times more likely to be accepted than another student with the same test scores.
9. I wonder why the graph has a few dips.
10. I wonder why the graph has a dip around the 0.5% middle class.
11. I wonder why the graph has a dip for people just below the top 0.1%.
12. I wonder what makes these people less likely to be accepted.
13. I am currently applying to college.
14. My classmates are currently applying to college.
15. This graph impacts me and my community.
16. It is important that we understand hidden factors that influence acceptance.
17. These hidden factors influence acceptance apart from test scores.
18. The headline is: Is being a legacy no longer a promise of acceptance?
19. The headline is: Top 0.1% fuel their own success.
20. The headline is: Is being wealthy the real deciding factor in college acceptances?
